intro: Strychnos congolana, commonly known as the Congo strychnos, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds surrounded by a fleshy aril. It is often found in forest understories and is adapted to humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
